nodes.helpText: If red flags are present (acute confusion, airway issues, instability), escalate per policy/provider direction.

options.label: Acute confusion/delirium or inability to understand

nodes.prompt: Is the refused medication time‑critical/high‑risk if missed?
nodes.helpText: Examples: anticoagulants, insulin, seizure meds, antibiotics (depending on indication), cardiac meds. Follow facility policy/orders.

nodes.prompt: Why is the resident refusing? (select all that apply)
Does the resident appear to understand risks/benefits (capacity for this decision)?
nodes.helpText: If capacity is uncertain or there is acute confusion, treat as change of condition and notify per policy.

nodes.title: Education + alternatives
nodes.body: Provide brief resident‑centered education on purpose and risks of refusal. Offer acceptable alternatives per policy: different timing, with food, alternate formulation only if allowed, and re‑approach later. Respect resident rights and avoid coercion.

nodes.helpText: Notify for time‑critical meds, repeated refusals, new symptoms, or safety concerns.

nodes.title: Select actions to include in the progress note

items.text: Verified which medication(s) were refused and scheduled time/dose
Assessed resident status (vitals/symptoms/mental status) and compared to baseline
Assessed stated reason for refusal and swallowing/tolerance concerns
Provided resident‑centered education on purpose and risks/benefits
Offered acceptable alternatives per policy and planned re‑approach
Implemented safety measures if refusal related to acute confusion or distress
Planned re‑approach and monitored for symptoms related to missed dose
Trending refusal pattern and escalating for repeated refusals or high‑risk meds
Documented medication, dose/time, refusal reason, and education provided
Notified provider/supervisor as indicated and documented orders/response
Notified responsible party/family as applicable per policy
Documented follow‑up plan (re‑approach timing, monitoring, escalation triggers)
